title: Veigar build
body: Is this a decent veigar build? Roa->morellonomicon->rabadons->banshees->voidstaff and of course boots somewhere in the middle.

replies.body:
As more of a Personal preference, I tend to build a little bit Brusery on him, Relying more on his passive AP gain. 

Usually I will get Morello's for CDR and mana sustain, followed by a Death cap. Everything beyond that is pretty situational depending on how my AP farm is doing, though I usually end up getting Merc treds over sorc shoes. I may also invest more in CDR to help me spell sling, which facilitates his passive AP gen. Maybe a Void staff if the enemy tanks are particularly problematic.

I play Veigar much differently than most people do. I do however have a ton of success with it too. Veigar is a glass cannon. BUT!! He can also be unexpectedly resilient. It's very easy to get 1K+ AP on him, and personally I feel like anything on top of that is something of a waste if you're not building him for survivability. That's why I prefer making him AP/HP based. That way even if he gets in a bad situation you still have enough life to force out a quick nuclear launch. So this is what I look like when making Veigar.

{{item:3027}} HP/AP
{{item:3285}} Movement/Burst
{{item:3089}} Duh
{{item:3151}} AP/HP/Pen
{{item:3001}} HP/MR/cooldown/10% more damage!!!

Like I said, very different, but this is what I prefer. Will this work for everyone? No. Will I change it based on different games?  Yea. If they are full of AD I might go Tabi and Zhonas. I'm not afraid to pump 200 armor on a viegar with 1000 AP lol.

This build here is quite annoying, specially if you are 1-2 of teh only ap champs on your team. As most enemy teams will stack armor instead. Also i know Sorc shoes is a standard pen item for most mages but if you use swifty shoes your movement speed is a bit better since you have ludens as well. Thats just my opinion since veig is slow as all shit and swiftys help kiting once your waiting on some of your cooldowns or trying to escape.

Honestly I play him totally different than others:

Runes:
15% CDR
7.8 Magic Pen
6.7 Magic Resist

Masteries:
12-18-0
Keystone Stormraiders

Summoners:
Flash
Barrier

Build:
Rush Tear > Rabadons > Sorc Shoes > Archangels > Void Staff > Lich Bane > (Either Hextech Gunblade or Nashoors Tooth) Depending on Playstyle lol

I don't like ROA on Veigar. I think you're better off with {{item:3157}} or {{item:3146}} in lategame.

{{item:3146}} doesn't seem attractive but it's a point&click 0.4 AP ratio + base damage on the mage with the highest ap ratio in game. It allows to basically Gunblade + R and instaburst a squishy without anything else and no counterplay; which is pretty nice because those squishies won't take much longer to kill you themselves.

RoA is good for when you are learning him because the health gives you room for error, but later when you are better with him you shouldn't need it and you can drop it from your build so that you can get your threatening items earlier.

I loosely follow Morellonomicon -> Sorc Shoes -> Deathcap as a core, after that is situational items.

If I am just wrecking them and have a massive lead I like to get Needlessly Large Rod first B into Lost Pages. This is very aggressive though and not the safest thing you can do.

If multiple enemies and specifically your prime targets are building mres go for the Void Staff next, if you are getting bursted down by magic damage then go for Banshees. If you are getting hit by things you can Zhonya's out of (Like a Syndra Ult) or if they have a physical damage threat that is bursting you down like a Lee Sin or a Zed then grab a Zhonya's Hourglass. If you are having none of those problems and are consistently bursting your targets down then get a tank item, I like to get Randuin's Omen on him.

There are other good items on him too, but those are what I would stick to until you are ready to experiment.

Not my favorite item on Veig but you can make it work. The problem is that with Veigar you are essentially trying to catch them with their pants around their ankles and unload all of your spells, meaning you don't have as much time for Lich Bane procs. It would be better for poke and sustained fights but those aren't really Veigar's jam.
i'd say morellos first to get q's off faster but don't see anything wrong with the items themselves.
If you are going to build RoA earlier is better than later, you can do Catalyst -> Lost Pages -> RoA effectively though, that is what I do on Anivia except with a tear instead of Lost Pages.

In another thread, someone said rushing Rabadon on mages is bad. You get more building other items like VoidSpeak first. Veigar may not apply because the AP boost is bigger with his passive, but that is one area to look into.

It depends on scalings, but usually going for an item that gives you damage on it is best as far as DPS and burst are concerned. Veigar is an odd case though because of what you pointed out. Usually you get it second item on him or third if you have to stall it out.
